definitions.definition: the act of discussing something with somebody or with a group of people before making a decision about it
definitions.sensetop: consultation with somebody/somethingin consultation with somebody/something

examples.text: The decision was taken after close consultation with local residents.
acting in consultation with all the departments involved
The company has promised wide consultation on its expansion plans.
The plan was developed in close consultation with the local community.
There will be a period of public consultation before a decision is reached.
They have taken this decision without any consultation.
We need more consultation with the unions.
A consultation period will be required.
He has been acting in consultation with all the departments involved.

definitions.definition: a formal meeting to discuss something

examples.text: There have been extensive consultations between the two countries.
a consultation between teachers and parents
The police chiefs will hold a consultation with all the relevant groups.

definitions.definition: a meeting with an expert, especially a doctor, to get advice or treatment

examples.text: I had a consultation with a dermatologist.
The practice provides medical consultations for drug addicts.
a joint consultation with doctors and patients

definitions.definition: the act of looking for information in a book, etc.

examples.text: There is a large collection of texts available for consultation online.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin consultatio(n-), from the verb consultare, frequentative of consulere ‘take counsel’.
